Function Documentation

i32 GF_add_subimage ( dptr_t  genptr,
dptr_t  subimptr,
i32  subxstart,
i32  subystart,
i32  subcols,
i32  subrows,
i32  totalcols 
)

Adds a subimage into a memory buffer. This is used to generate a simple (flat) fits image from multiple amplifiers. Basicaly "builds" the image geometry on memory

Parameters:
[in] genptr pointer to big (complete) image buffer
[in] subimptr pointer to pice of image to be added
[in] subxstart x position of the subimage to be added, in general image coordinate
[in] subxstart x position of the subimage to be added, in general image coordinate [in] subcols number of cols of subimage [in] subrows number of rows of subimage [in] totalcols total number of cols of big image

void* GF_allocate_image_buf ( size_t *  size,
i32 *  id,
i32 *  qid 
)

Allocates a memory buffer for the fits image. If using shared memory the segment is shared

void GF_close (  ) 

closes all, and releases the buffers

i32 GF_compress_img ( fitsfile *  fptr,
char *  name 
)

Sets the data compression for the fits image

Parameters:
[in] name the name of the fits image, containing the compression directives
[in] fitsfile the fits file descriptor

parses the compressionn instructions in the name. This is used only for compressing memory fits files; otherwise, the cfistio functions take care of this by themselves

dptr_t GF_create_file ( char *  name,
i32 *  err 
)

Creates fits file called by GF_create_img() [in] name fits file name (in disk)

Parameters:
[out] err status out

ptr_t GF_create_img ( char *  name,
i32  data,
i32  hdu,
i32  mult,
ptr_t  amplifiers,
i32  nkeys,
i32 *  err 
)

Creates an image in the file (acording to the given parameters) called by the user program

Parameters:
[in] name image name
[in] data image datatype (ushort,short, etc)
[in] hdu hdu type
[in] mult multiple (>0) or single (==0) extensions file
[in] amplifiers pointer to the internal amplifiers structure
[in] nkeys optional parameter to preallocate space for the keywords. Ignored if <=0
[out] *err status code out

i32 GF_fits_close_file ( ptr_t  ref,
i32  err 
)

Closes fits file

i32 GF_fits_movabs_hdu ( ptr_t  ref,
i32  hdunum,
i32  hdutyp 
)

Moves the current hdu to the specified absolute one hdunum (over which the operations are performed) in an absolute way (absolute reference)

Parameters:
[in] ref reference to fits file
[in] hdunum number of target hdu
[in] hdutyp type of hdu (cfitsio types)

i32 GF_fits_set_values ( i32  data,
i32  hdu,
i32  mult,
ptr_t  amplifiers 
)

Sets basic setup values for the fits image to be created. This is called prior to writing the data Fills the internal fits amplifiers structure coming from outside (unscrambler/geometry modules) called by GF_create_img()

Parameters:
[in] data image datatype (short, ushort, etc)
[in] hdu hdutype
[in] mult multiple (>0) or single (==0) extensions fits image
[in] amplifiers pointer to the internal amplifier structure (containing the geometry)

i32 GF_fits_set_zaxis ( i32  nz  ) 

Sets the value of the Z coordinate (depth) in a datacube (third axis)

Parameters:
[in] z amount of frames in cube

Writes image in mmeory to the file name specified

ptr_t GF_simple_data_write ( char *  name,
i32  ncols,
i32  nrows,
i32  dtype,
ptr_t  bptr,
i32  ntries,
i32 *  err 
)

Writes a fits image using no internal structure, but just thedata passed here, from the provided buffer

Parameters:
[in] name is the name of the fits file to be written (full path)
[in] ncols total number of columns
[in] nrows total number of rows
[in] dtype image data type (cfitsio types)
[in] *bptr pointer to buffer with the pixel data to be written
[in] ntries number of attemptrs before giving up [out] *err output status

i32 GF_writeImage ( ptr_t  ref,
ptr_t  amplifiers,
i32  eleRead,
i32 *  progress,
i32 *  zcnt,
i32 *  num_amps 
)

Writes a single or multiple extension fits image or piece of fits image to disk (or memory)

Parameters:
[in] ref reference to fits image
[in] amplifiers pointer to amplifiers structure
[in] eleRead number of elements to write
[out] *progress percentage of progress over the total image [out] *zcn counbter of number of frames if writen a datacube (3 axes) [out] *num_amps number of valid amplifiers (total amps - discraded amps)

i32  bitpix,
i32  naxis,
flong *  naxes 
)

Inserts a new image into a file (for a new extension)

Parameters:
[in] ref reference to fits file
[in] bitpix type of image (BITPIX cfitsio types)
[in] naxis number of axes in the image (2 for regular fits image, 3 for a datacube)
[in] naxes array containing the size (in elements/pixels) in each dimension

i32  nmove,
i32 *  hdutyp

Parameters:
[in] ref reference to fits file
[in] nmove number of relative movements
[in] hdutyp type of hdu (cfitsio types)

char *  data,
char *  bias,
char *  ccd,
char *  amp,
char *  trim,
char *  det,
char *  ccdsize,
char *  amplifier 
)

Add into the headers all the geometry keywords that correspons to a multiple-extension fits file (per-amp basis). DEPRECATED

char *  Asec,
char *  Bsec,
char *  Csec,
char *  Dsec,

char *  amplifier

i32 labfits_write_key ( ptr_t  ref,
i32  datatype,
char *  keyname,
void *  value,
char *  comment 
)

Adds a keyword into the headers

Parameters:
[in] ref reference to fits file
[in] datatype type of keyword (cfitsio types)
[in] keyname name of the keyword
[in] value pointer to value
[in] comment string comment to write to the keyword

i32 labfits_write_key_from_char ( ptr_t  ref,
i32  datatype,
char *  keyname,
char *  value,
char *  comment 
)

Adds a keyword into the headers, taking the value as a string, and converting it internally

Parameters:
[in] ref reference to fits file
[in] datatype type of keyword (cfitsio types)
[in] keyname name of the keyword
[in] value string value. For example. "5"
[in] comment string comment to write to the keyword

i32 labfits_writw_key_from_array ( ptr_t  ref,
dptr_t *  typearr,
char *  namearr,
char *  valarr,
char *  commarr,
i32  nkeys 
)

Adds an array into several keyword into the headers

Parameters:
[in] ref reference to fits file
[in] typearr array containing the datatype of each keyword in the array
[in] namearr array of names of each keyword in the array (same size as typearr)
[in] valarr char values of each keyword in the array (same size as namearr and typearr)
[in] commarr string array of comment for each keyword (same size as the others)
